poem:
### The Window's Gaze  

Why, in this isle of gray gaze,  
do windows lean outward,  
like arms reaching for rain?  
Is it the yearning of souls  
to touch the approaching world—  
or the timid retreat,  
offering our homes  
to the scrutinous skies,  
while we hide behind glass,  
under the weight of our  
own reflections?
